<DOMAIN>DESIGNER</DOMAIN>
<RESUME_START>
MARKETING SPECIALIST GRAPHIC DESIGNER
Professional Summary
Accomplished, creative marketing professional with proven success in graphic design, corporate marketing communications, project and event management and print production management.
Recognized for the ability to perform multiple tasks at one time while meeting multiple client needs, completing projects efficiently and within or under budget, and having a high attention to detail.
Respected for always setting and meeting high quality standards, being a team player willing to do whatever is needed to get the job done, and building and maintaining honest and loyal relationships.
Seeking creative position that will allow me to use my creative abilities and business acumen to bring a brand to life.
Core Qualifications
Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign as well as Microsoft Office programs Powerpoint, Word and Excel. Areas of knowledge and expertise include: Art Direction (design, illustration, photography) Corporate Brand Strategy Graphic Design (proficient in Adobe Creative Suites) Corporate Marketing Communications Creative Print and Digital Content Development Event/Trade Show Management Print Production Management Project Management

EXPERIENCE

Marketing Specialist Graphic Designer
January 2005
to
January 2016
Company Name
— City , State
Managed strategic direction of corporate brand strategy and creative design for all marketing communications including advertising, digital, sales collateral, trade publications, website, event marketing and training materials.
Selected Accomplishments: Drove the process and implementation of the corporate brand strategy throughout all communication avenues and to all target audiences including extensive network of dealers (35 Dealers/250 locations) to maintain brand consistency while increasing brand awareness.
Developed and designed all corporate marketing communications including art direction of illustrators, photographers, copywriters/journalists, printers and industry agencies to ensure on time and on budget campaigns.
Annual printing budget: $300,000 with an annual increase of 15%.
Developed integrated marketing and branding campaigns for all internal corporate meetings and events.
Attendance ranging from 10 to 1,000.
Marketing budgets ranging from $500 to $250,000.
Integrated and managed an on-line literature ordering system increasing the visibility and accessibility of product sales collateral.
Includes 150+ skus.
Average of 35 orders per month.
Built and maintained integral relationships with counterparts at Wirtgen Group headquarters in Germany as well as other Wirtgen Group subsidiaries throughout the world establishing trust and easing overall communications.
Coordinated and implemented an on-line registration process for training curriculum that automated the registration process allowing for data collection and reporting of over 9,000 registrants a year.
Trained additional employees to implement and maintain the ongoing training schedules/changes.
Owner

Conceptualized and designed marketing collateral, public relation campaigns, website, advertising, and press releases resulting in an increase in fan base, ticket sales and sponsorship acquisitions.
Managed all day-to-day activities including budget planning, hiring of staff, player relations, tryouts, game day operations and merchandising.
Finished with winning records in all four seasons including conference title in 2001 and undefeated season, conference title in 2005.

Designed and directed the production of fundraising catalog including multiple versions with variable information specific to desired industry.

PIAS Awards: Best of Category, Award of Excellence and Award of Merit.

Selected Accomplishments: Designed international, multi-language packaging.
Trained all incoming designers.
Graphic Designer, Senior Graphic Designer, Lead Artist

to

Manufacturer and distributor of personal care health and beauty products for the store brand industry.
Member of an eight-person design team responsible for all corporate marketing material as well as designing personal care product packaging for various US and International clientele.
Selected Accomplishments: Piloted the "Traveling Artist" program resulting in an expedited design approval process.
Designed multi-language personal care packaging and promotional material for companies such as Walmart, Walgreens and Kroger as well as various international companies.
Designed corporate newsletter, presentation slides, sales brochures and POP displays.
Promoted multiple times within my tenure.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Engineering/Marketing Admin

Location: Vancouver, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Engineering/Marketing Administrator
Major Goals
This position will support project and office administration as well as sales/marketing and business development efforts in our growth-oriented professional engineering consulting firm. 
Qualifications· Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and work independently as well as in team environments, often under tight deadline situations. · Possesses a friendly, collaborative demeanor and enjoys working with others in a creative environment toward shared goals.· High level of attention to detail and adherence to high quality standards.· Demonstrated solid writing, editing, and proofreading skills. · Proficient in Microsoft Outlook, Word, and Excel. · Strong knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign) and presentation software (PowerPoint) along with strong presentation design skills. · Willingness and ability to take on projects as reasonable without extensive technical oversight. Ability to take ownership of a project and see it through to completion.· Ability to interact, support, and motivate internally, as well as ability to professionally interface with external contacts (clients, subconsultants, vendors, etc.).
Key Result Areas
1. Administrative Activities a. Create project files, both electronic and file folders. b. Support office in the establishment and upkeep of hard copy and electronic project filing systems, archiving, and general organizational efforts to keep office running smoothly. c. Assist in maintenance of Project Manager/ Quality Management Manual. d. Organize and maintain technical library and conduct research when needed. e. Filing of project information in accordance with company standards.f. Other administrative and project coordination activities, including but not limited to: o Arrange flight, hotel, and car reservations for employees on company business. o Organize and execute staff meetings and other office functions. o Maintain document retention and destruction policies. Review project files on annual basis for compliance. Act, as needed, to bring project files into compliance. 
2. Office Management Activities a. Maintain the smooth operation of the telephone system, printers, and other office equipment including knowledge of maintenance agreements.b. Maintain office asset inventory and add new inventory as needed. c. Order workroom and lunchroom supplies. d. Coordinate the check out/in of office equipment in the equipment pool. e. Maintain company office calendar.f. On monthly basis, generate copy count report. g. Assist with new employee orientation. h. Manage weekly and monthly staff meetings for the office. 
3. Project Activities a. Prepare project deliverables, including transmittals, proposals, letters, reports, calculation packages. b. Work with engineers during construction administration. Track deadlines for RFI’s, Submittals, Action items, etc. and ensure timely task completion. c. Meet with Project Managers on a weekly basis and assist them as required. Communicate daily with project team regarding deliverable schedules. d. Review all external communications (reports/memos/letters) for compliance with WRK Document Standards. e. Create project public folders in Outlook and associated email requirements for storage. f. Assist as needed with daily preparation of drafting calendar for independent contractor, and upload project drafting onto WRK Engineers OneDrive site. Download and file drafting the next morning when completed. 
4. Marketing a. Work with Project Managers to respond to project pursuits by helping produce high-quality and persuasive proposals and presentations, including formatting, writing/editing, graphic layout and production, and efficient/timely production. b. Assist with graphic design of presentation and collateral materials.c. Work with Project Managers to develop and execute targeted advertising and social media campaigns.d. Provide general business development support by developing and maintaining client mailing lists and marketing files.e. Assist with input and accuracy of Client Resource Management (CRM) information. f. Develop, update, and maintain marketing materials including, including but not limited to:· Marketing department standards, project information, photography files, and past proposals· Project information sheets· Personnel resumes Classification:This position is classified as full-time, exempt.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
